title: Nvidia says it will record $5.5 billion charge tied to H20 processors exported to China

title: United Airlines gives two 2025 profit outlooks, calling economy 'impossible' to predict
description: United Airlines said a deterioration in bookings could lead it to lower its 2025 outlook to $7 to $9 a share from $11.50 to $13.50.

title: #2273 What happened to our partnership?
description: Before I partnered with Jesse Pujji, we were buddy-buddy. Texting all the time. When we got started, we got excited about the world of possibilities for our company. Now? Something is missing. I asked him about it. And about where he put his money, why he‚Äôs not launching more companies now, what he‚Äôs building with AI, and more. Jesse Pujji is the founder of Gateway X, the venture studio. Jesse & Andrew are building Bootstrapped Giants, a resource for ambitious, unfunded founders. More interviews -> https://mixergy.com/moreint Rate this interview -> https://mixergy.com/rateint
author: Andrew Warner

title: #2272 Aux: >$10mil advising private equity
description: When Kasey Grelle heard that private equity companies paid marketing agencies to evaluate companies they wanted to buy, she spotted a business opportunity. That realization became Aux Insights, the firm that‚Äôs become ‚Äúthe office of the CMO‚Äù for private equity companies. Listen to how they got clients & built their business. Kasey is a former reporter who founded Aux Insights, a global advisory firm that acts as the office of the CMO for private equity firms, specializing in digital growth strategy and marketing diligence. When she‚Äôs not scaling businesses, she‚Äôs up before dawn at 4 AM, savoring the quiet magic of early morning work before the chaos of her three-kid household kicks in. title: The Conversations You Should Be Having with Your Manager
description: As you advance in your career, you develop the skills to lead teams and manage direct reports. But no matter your role or seniority, you‚Äôll always need to manage those above you and to develop the right relationships to progress. The secret to managing up, says Melody Wilding, is being strategic and thoughtful in several key kinds of conversations with your boss and boss‚Äôs boss‚Äîincluding finding alignment, setting boundaries, getting visibility for your work, and winning a promotion. She explains how the effort pays off both in future opportunities and your day-to-day satisfaction on the job. Wilding is an executive coach and the author of the book¬†Managing Up: How to Get What You Need from the People in Charge.

title: What All Leaders Can Learn from Taylor Swift
description: Whether you're a fan of Taylor Swift or not, no one can deny her success as both a music star and businesswoman. Her career has been a masterclass in everything from customer connection to innovation, decision-making to digital adaption, offering lessons for people in any industry. HBR senior editor Kevin Evers investigated Swift's rise and evolution for his new book, There's Nothing Like This: The Strategic Genius of Taylor Swift, and found interesting patterns. He explains how she's kept audiences loyal, why her Eras tour was so successful, and the vision and "productive paranoia" that have kept her on top. Evers also wrote the HBR article "The Strategic Genius of Taylor Swift."

title: Morgan Stanley slashes Sensex target to 82,000
description: The brokerage cut its Gross Domestic Product (GDP) growth estimates by 40 basis points to 6.1% and expects a slower recovery of 6.3% in FY27, against its earlier forecast of 6.5%.

title: Auto and ancillary company shares zoom on tariff reprieve hopes
description: The Nifty Auto index ended 3.4% higher on Tuesday, against benchmark Nifty's gains of 2.2%. Samvardhana Motherson International was the top performer on the index, up 8%, followed by Balkrishna Industries, Bharat Forge and Tata Motors, which gained 4.5-7% each.

title: Turf Wars, Tree Men & Murder: Inside the world of Christmas tree selling in NYC
description: Christmas trees are big business in NYC. Running a tree lot takes grit and experience, and even then, it's a tough network to break into. All of the lots in the city are divided into separate territories, owned by only a handful of entrepreneurs. We spent the day working for NYC's busiest Christmas tree seller on Greg Walsh's busiest day of the year to better understand the wild logistics behind NYC‚Äôs Christmas tree economy and the tumultuous history of running a lot in this city. Get the Side Hustle Ideas Database: https://clickhubspot.com/ogv
author: HubSpot

title: What does winning a James Beard Award really mean for chefs?
description: Often called the Oscars of the food industry, the James Beard Foundation Awards are among the most coveted for chefs in America. But what's sold and packaged as prestige can sometimes become a distraction from managing the business that got you there. Host Matt Brown is joined by The New York Times food critic Brett Anderson & chef Chintan Pandya (Dhamaka, Semma, Adda, Unapologetic Foods) to learn that an award can not only change a winner's life but an entire industry as a whole.
author: HubSpot

title: Bridging the Courage Gap in Your Business
description: Dr. Margie Warrell is a bestselling author, leadership coach, and global authority on courage, risk-taking, and transformational leadership. She‚Äôs worked with Fortune 500 companies, coached C-suite executives, and spoken at the US Congress‚Äîempowering thousands to lead with boldness and integrity. In this episode, we dive into her latest book, The Courage Gap: Five Steps to Braver Action, exploring how fear, self-doubt, and imposter syndrome silently sabotage decision-making and business growth. Margie shares powerful strategies for building your ‚Äúcourage muscle,‚Äù raising your rates with confidence, and taking bold action even amid uncertainty. title: SEO Tactics That Actually Work in 2025
description: Prasanna Dhungel is the co-founder and managing partner at Grow By Data, with nearly two decades of experience leading innovation in marketing, tech, healthcare, and SaaS. A graduate of Cornell, Princeton, and Kellogg School of Management, Prasanna brings deep expertise in digital strategy and search engine evolution. In this episode, he breaks down the future of SEO in an AI-dominated world‚Äîcovering Google‚Äôs AI overview, zero-click searches, and how brand visibility is being redefined. You'll learn what‚Äôs working in 2025, how to adapt your content strategy, and the key metrics top marketers are using to stay ahead. title: Vizio: William Wang
description: When Wiliam Wang started selling flat-screen TV‚Äôs, he used a winning playbook: partner with an efficient manufacturer, cut out the middlemen, and price your product as low as you can. William used a similar strategy at his first company‚Äìmaking computer monitors‚Äìand he built it into a multimillion dollar business. But he wound up mismanaging it into the ground, and spent years working to pay off millions of dollars in debt. After surviving a catastrophic plane crash, William embarked on a new venture, Vizio, and returned to his ‚Äúcut-out-the-middlemen‚Äù playbook to sell one of the world‚Äôs first internet-connected televisions. Today, Vizio is one of the top-selling TV‚Äôs in the US, and in 2024, sold to Walmart for $2.3 billion.This episode was produced by J.C. Howard, with music by Ramtin Arablouei.Edited by Neva Grant, with research help from Alex Cheng.You can follow HIBT on¬†Twitter¬†&¬†Instagram, and email us at¬†hibt@id.wondery.com. title: Advice Line with Peter Rahal of RXBAR
description: RXBAR co-founder Peter Rahal joins Guy on the Advice Line, where they answer questions from three early-stage founders about positioning new products in competitive markets. Plus, Peter‚Äôs take on getting back in the game with his newest venture, David Protein.¬†First we meet Kristi from Calgary, who‚Äôs considering digital ads as¬† her women‚Äôs supplements brand maxes out on organic growth. Then Erik from Los Angeles, who‚Äôs wondering if Amazon is a necessary channel¬† for his exercise accessories. And April from New York, who‚Äôs hoping to find the right messaging for her line of cocktail mixers.Thank you to the founders of Inner Wellth, SquatWedgiez, and Cheeky Cocktails for being a part of our show.If you‚Äôd like to be featured on a future Advice Line episode, leave us a one-minute message that tells us about your business and a specific question you‚Äôd like answered.
